fields_of_interest: Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights
eu_initiatives: Anything related to education, especially secondary school education. We are interested in topics like Europe 2020, ET 2020, the Education and Training Monitor, the Erasmus+ Programme and the activities of CULT. We also follow on the Elections and their influence on education
organisation_name: Organising Bureau of European School Student Unions (OBESSU)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: Finnbogadóttir# Sara Þöll, LANTAI#Judit, Lipari#Giuseppe, O'DONNELL#Robert Francis, TUCCI#Giuseppina, VABUOLAS#Edvardas
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Advisory Committee for Vocational Training#X01803#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1803#Observer#C#European Credit for Vocational Education and Training Users' Group#E02251#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2251#Member#C
membership: OBESSU is a member of the European Youth Forum (YFJ) and of the European Civil Society Platform on Lifelong Learning (LLL-P), as well as the Migration Policy Network SIRIUS. We are also an Associated Member of the European Students' Union (ESU).
relevant_communication: OBESSU runs several projects every year, many of them funded by the EU or Council of Europe. For a list of recent activities, see http://www.obessu.org/what-we-did; for a list of upcoming activities see http://www.obessu.org
